Question.Subject: The first Internet browser in history,what is it called?
Question.Content: 10 points if you're very quick!! The first Internet browser in it's story that allows you to navigate.
Question.ChosenAnswer:
They are all wrong!.
The first internet browser in history was not Netscape, that was the first commercial one.
The first web browser was NCSA Mosaic!
http://www.livinginternet.com/w/wi_browse.htm
Okay the above is my original answer, just to remain honest I was dead wrong -.-, WorldWideWeb was the first Web Browser, I aplogize

Answer.Content: The very 1st was in fact WorldWideWeb, by Tim Berners-Lee, 1991. At that time it was the only way to access the internet. This was followed in 1993 by NCSA Mosaic. Though it's true to say that the netscape Navigator was the one that was the 1st to be widely used.
Answer.Reference:
Edit: we are not all wrong! NCSA Mosaic was based on the WorldWideWeb original. Do your research, Glenn.
"The history of the web browser dates back in to the late 1980s, when a variety of technologies laid the foundation for the first web browser, WorldWideWeb, by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991. That browser brought together a variety of existing and new software and hardware technologies."
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_the_web_browser

Answer.Content: It was the world wide web, but the answer you may be looking for is Mosaic or Opera, both of those were considered the first main stream browsers. Mosaic came first and Opera about a year later

They are all wrong!.
The first internet browser in history was not Netscape, that was the first commercial one.
The first web browser was NCSA Mosaic!
http://www.livinginternet.com/w/wi_browse.htm
Okay the above is my original answer, just to remain honest I was dead wrong -.-, WorldWideWeb was the first Web Browser, I aplogize
